lines.text: From what you say about this fella Savin, he must be some man to reckon with.
He's not only bad, he's smart... and that's a dangerous combination.
There's more brands on this herd than a dog has fleas!
You know, Lucky, I can't understand why a fella that's as fast with a dad-gum pistols as you are and such a good a shot - what are you hangin' around here bein' a cowpoke for?
There's nothing wrong with being a cowpoke, Cannonball, if that's what you wanna be - and I like it.
[Barko and Cutter offer Lucky $100 a month to join Krag Savin's gunmen]
Say that's quite a proposition. Sure, I'll take it!
Good. You'll meet us at sundown and we'll head for Pinon City.
Be right there, Mr. Cutter
Barko's the name.
Barko? Glad to meet you, Mr. Barko.
Cutter's the name.

[to Lucky]
What did that fella say his name was?
Which one?
The other one?
Oh, the other one.
[disgustedly]
George!
What do you think, Bob?
Pretty smooth jaspers, Lucky.
Yeah, they sure are. Men don't pay gun wages without a reason... and I'm just curious enough to find out what it's all about.
I'm afraid Lucky's lettin' himself in for a lot of trouble.
I'm thinkin' 'bout the same way you are, Bob. I'm gonna be right on his footsteps as long as my feet hold out.
Hey, Cannonball, you'd better wait here. I'm not so sure how these people are gonna receive us.
I know, Lucky, but maybe you'll need some help.
If I do, I send you after some.

It's men like Parker that build up the West and bring progress to it, not men like you. It's the sweat and blood of the little men that makes this country the great country that it is, not the greed of the so-called big ones.
